section_description:
TAD:

- Currently fully rolled out to iOS users 
- Targeting Android users via experiment: `mobile_offline_mode_feature`
title: Offline mode: Open Shifts first page is cached

custom_steps_separated.content: Having your internet enabled, navigate to the open shifts screen, and make sure that there are shifts listed
Being there in the open shifts screen, disable your internet connection
custom_steps_separated.expected:
There should be a banner in the top of the screen with the text:

"You seem to be offline, check your connection  Reload or Hide"


  ![](index.php?/attachments/get/def12345-2222-3333-4444-555555555551)

Should be able to re-load the screen

Yellow banner at the top with “Try again” should be visible


  ![](index.php?/attachments/get/def12345-2222-3333-4444-555555555552)

custom_steps_separated.content: Press the try again banner from the top yellow banner
custom_steps_separated.expected: The same screen should be reloaded with the yellow banner still visible
The same screen should be reloaded with the yellow banner still visible

custom_steps_separated.content: In the open shifts screen, scroll to the bottom of the list, so that the UI attempts to lazy load more shifts
custom_steps_separated.expected:
- A persistent spinner should be shown in the bottom of the screen



   ![](index.php?/attachments/get/def12345-2222-3333-4444-555555555553)

custom_steps_separated.content: Enable your internet again, tap on the "Try again" CTA from the top yellow banner
custom_steps_separated.expected: The top yellow banner should disappear
